actions: Releases the exterior, induces sweating, disperses Cold and unblocks Yang.
With Dan Dou Chi, treats elderly or weak patients, pregnant women and children during any season for either Hot or Cold pathogens
With Dan Dou Chi and Sheng Jiang, for the initial stages of External Wind-Cold invasion.
Discharges Exterior conditions, releases the muscles, especially of the neck and upper back and raises Spleen Yang.
Releases the Exterior, induces perspiration, disperses Cold, warms the Lungs, stops coughing, normalizes the flow of Qi at the center and reduces the toxicity of other herbs.
Releases the Exterior and harmonizes the Middle Jiao.
With Cong Bai, for colds associated with Yin Deficiency.
With Sheng Di Huang, for hematemesis or epistaxis due to Yin Deficiency with Excess Heat.
Clears Heat, cools the Blood and nourishes Yin.

syndromes: Exterior Wind-Cold with underlying Yin or Blood Deficiency

contraindications: Administer very slowly and only after it has been determined that the patient is not sweating.
Avoid Fr. Ulmi Preparatus Wu Yi while taking this formula.

notes: This syndrome usually appears following long-term illness or significant Blood loss.

Blood Deficiency with Wind-Cold during pregnancy or postpartum with signs of Heat
Blood Deficiency with Wind-Cold during pregnancy or postpartum with continual bleeding
Blood Deficiency with Wind-Cold during pregnancy or postpartum with poor digestion, anorexia and abdominal distention
